00034 // To hold and managed a set of open Connect *'s. 
00035 //
00036 // jhrg 9/30/94
00037 
00038 #ifdef __GNUG__
00039 #pragma implementation 
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 #include "config_dap.h"
00043 
00044 #include <assert.h>
00045 
00046 #include "debug.h"
00047 
00048 #include "Connections.h"
00049 
00050 using std::cerr;
00051 using std::endl;
00052 
00053 // private mfuncs
00054 
00055 template <class T>
00056 void
00057 Connections<T>::init_array(int i)
00058 {
00059     while (i--) {
00060     _free.push_back(i);
00061     _conns[i] = NULL;
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00065 // public mfuncs
00066 
00074 template <class T>
00075 Connections<T>::Connections(int i)
00076 {
00077     _max_con = i;
00078 
00079     _conns = new T[i];
00080 
00081     init_array(_max_con);
00082     DBG(cerr << "Finished Connections ctor (" << i << ")\n");
00083 }
00084 
00086 template <class T>
00087 Connections<T>::Connections(const Connections<T> &cs)
00088 {
00089     _max_con = cs._max_con;
00090 
00091     _conns = new T[_max_con];
00092 
00093     init_array(_max_con);
00094 }
00095     
00096 template <class T>
00097 Connections<T>::~Connections()
00098 {
00099     delete [] _conns;
00100     _conns = 0;
00101 }
00102 
00103 template <class T>
00104 Connections<T> &
00105 Connections<T>::operator=(const Connections<T> &rhs)
00106 {
00107     if (this == &rhs)
00108     return *this;
00109 
00110     _max_con = rhs._max_con;
00111 
00112     _conns = new T[_max_con];
00113 
00114     init_array(_max_con);
00115 
00116     return *this;
00117 }
00118     
00119 // Given an index into the array of managed connections, return the
00120 // corresponding Connect *.
00121 //
00122 // NB: Return a reference so that this will work on both the left and right
00123 // sides of the assignement operator!
00124 //
00125 // Returns: A reference to the Connect *
00126 
00138 template <class T>
00139 T &
00140 Connections<T>::operator[](int i)
00141 {
00142     return _conns[i];
00143 }
00144 
00145 // Add the Connect * to the array of managed connections.
00146 //
00147 // Returns: integer index to Connect * or -1 if the array is full.
00148 
00155 template <class T>
00156 int
00157 Connections<T>::add_connect(T c)
00158 {
00159     if (_free.empty()) {
00160     cerr << "add_connect: too many connects, cannot add another" << endl;
00161     return -1;
00162     }
00163 
00164     int i = _free.back(); // pop the first element
00165     _free.pop_back();
00166 
00167     assert(!_conns[i]);
00168     
00169     _conns[i] = c;
00170 
00171     return i;
00172 }
00173 
00174 
00185 template <class T>
00186 void
00187 Connections<T>::del_connect(int i)
00188 {
00189     _free.push_back(i);
00190     _conns[i] = NULL;
00191 }

00219 // redefine Pix to be an IteratorAdapter. Usage remains the same and all code
00220 // outside of the DAP should compile and link with no problems. Added methods
00221 // to the different classes where Pix is used to include methods to use STL
00222 // iterators. Replaced the use of Pix within the DAP to use iterators instead.

00247 // Revision 1.15.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00248 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00249 // I added those where they were needed.
00250 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00251 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00252 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00253 // just good form when using delete.
00254 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00255 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00256 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00257 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00258 // characters on their own.
